project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the Road Sector Development Program Support Project are to contribute to Ethiopia's economic development by i) improving trunk and regional rural road access and utilization to meet the agricultural and other economic development needs; ii) building up the institutional capacity in both the public and private sectors for sustainable road development and maintenance; and iii) providing economic opportunity for the rural poor both through increased employment in rural road works and development of appropriate affordable means of transport and services.  There are seven components in this project.  The first component is rehabilitation/strengthening of paved trunk roads.  The second component will upgrade trunk routes from gravel to asphalt paved standard.  The third component will comprise consultant services for the supervision of the above civil works.  The fourth component will finance institutional strengthening and capacity building support for the Ethiopian Roads Authority.  The fifth component will provide cofinancing for the provision of technical assistance and capacity building for four Regional State Rural Roads Organizations.  The sixth component will include environmental guidelines and sector environmental assessment (EA) capacity building.  The seventh component will finance technical preparation of rural roads improvements.
